org.fluidity.foundation.jarjar

Class Handler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.URLStreamHandler
      • org.fluidity.foundation.jarjar.Handler

  • public final class Handler
extends URLStreamHandler
    Stream protocol handler to work with resources inside JAR archives embedded in other JAR archives, ad infinitum.

    When loaded, it adds its enclosing package to the protocol handler package list to make itself known. This stream protocol handler makes it possible for an ordinary URLClassLoader to work with JAR archives embedded in other JAR archives, enabling packaged Java applications without loss of functionality such as signed JAR files, etc.

    To use this stream handler, all you need to do is create URLs that map to this stream protocol handler. For example, if you have a JAR archive named my-archive.jar that embeds another JAR archive, my-dependency.jar, the following will create an URL that can then be fed to an URL class loader: 

     final URL embedded = Handler.formatURL(new File("my-archive.jar").toURI().toURL(), null, "my-dependency.jar");

    • Field Detail

      • PROTOCOL

        public static final String PROTOCOL
        The URL protocol understood by this handler. The value is computed to be the last component of the containing package.

      • DELIMITER

        public static final String DELIMITER
        The path component delimiter in a valid URL.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Handler

        public Handler()
        Used by the URL stream handler framework. Do not call this constructor directly.

    • Method Detail

      • parseURL

        public static URL parseURL(String specification)
                    throws MalformedURLException
        Parses the given nested URL specification and returns the parsed URL.
        Parameters:
        specification - the nested archive URL in text form.
        Returns:
        an URL with the given specification.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - when the Java URL cannot be created.

      • formatURL

        public static URL formatURL(URL root,
                            String... path)
                     throws MalformedURLException
        Creates a URL to a resource in a JAR archive nested in other JAR archives at any level.
        Parameters:
        root - the URL of the (possibly already nested) JAR archive.
        path - the list of entry names within the preceding archive entry in the list, or the root archive in case of the first path; may be empty, in which case the root URL is returned. If the last item is null, the returned URL will point to a nested archive; if the last item is not null, the returned URL will point to a JAR resource inside a (potentially nested) archive.
        Returns:
        a jarjar: pointing either to a nested archive, or a JAR resource within a nested archive.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - when URL formatting fails.

      • rootURL

        public static URL rootURL(URL url)
                   throws IOException
        Returns the root URL of the given URL returned by a previous call to formatURL(URL, String...). The returned URL can then be fed back to formatURL(URL, String...) to target other nested JAR archives.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to return the root of.
        Returns:
        the root URL.
        Throws:
        IOException - when processing the URL fails.

      • unload

        public static void unload(URL url)
        Unloads the contents of the given URL from the caches.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL to unload the contents of.

      • access

        public static <T,E extends Exception> T access(Command.Process<T,E> command)
                                        throws E extends Exception
        Isolates the effects on the caching of nested archives of the given command from the rest of the application. The isolated cache is inherited by threads created by command but it will not be stable outside a call to this method by a new thread made while this call was still in scope.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the command.
        E - the exception type thrown by the command.
        Parameters:
        command - the command that potentially accesses nested archives.
        Returns:
        whatever the command returns.
        Throws:
        E - as is thrown by the command.
        E extends Exception

      • capture

        public static Object capture(boolean active)
        Captures the current content of the archives cache.
        Parameters:
        active - if true, only the active items are retained from the cache, all else is dropped; if false, all items will be retained. Active items are those that have been accessed in the nearest enclosing invocation of access(Object, Command.Process).
        Returns:
        a cache context.

      • access

        public static <T,E extends Exception> T access(Object context,
                                               Command.Process<T,E> command)
                                        throws E extends Exception
        Isolates the effects on the caching of nested archives of the given command from the rest of the application. The isolated cache is inherited by threads created by command but it will not be stable outside a call to this method by a new thread made while this call was still in scope.

        The initial content of the cache will consist of what has been captured in the given context and whatever else is in the cache at the point of invocation.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the command.
        E - the exception type thrown by the command.
        Parameters:
        context - the cache contents captured using a previous capture(boolean) call.
        command - the command that potentially accesses nested archives.
        Returns:
        whatever the command returns.
        Throws:
        E - as is thrown by the command.
        E extends Exception

      • cached

        public static byte[] cached(URL url)
                     throws IOException
        Returns the cached contents of the given archive, loading it first if necessary.
        Parameters:
        url - the URL of the archive.
        Returns:
        the contents of the given archive, or null if the URL does not point to an archive.
        Throws:
        IOException - when loading the archive fails.
